trans-unit.source: Waiting threads are signalled in FIFO order.

trans-unit.source: Waits (indefinitely or with timeout) to accept a connection from a target VM. Returns a connection representing the bi-directional communication channel to the target VM.
Waits a specified time for the next available event.
Waits at most millis milliseconds for this thread to die.
Waits at most millis milliseconds for this thread to die. A timeout of 0 means to wait forever.
trans-unit.target: Espera en la mayoría de millis milisegundos para este hilo para mueren. Un tiempo de espera de 0 significa esperar eternamente.

trans-unit.source: Waits at most millis milliseconds plus nanos nanoseconds for this thread to die.
trans-unit.target: Espera en la mayoría de millis milisegundos más nanos nanosegundos para este hilo para mueren.

trans-unit.source: Waits at most millis milliseconds plus nanos nanoseconds for this thread to die. If both arguments are 0, it means to wait forever.
Waits for a target VM to attach to this connector.

Waits for another thread to arrive at this exchange point (unless the current thread is interrupted or the specified waiting time elapses), and then transfers the given object to it, receiving its object in return.
Waits for another thread to arrive at this exchange point (unless the current thread is interrupted), and then transfers the given object to it, receiving its object in return.

Waits for another thread to arrive at this exchange point (unless the current thread is interrupted or the specified waiting time elapses), and then transfers the given object to it, receiving its object in return.
trans-unit.target: Espera a que otro hilo llegue a este punto de intercambio (a menos que el hilo actual se interrumpa o transcurra el tiempo de espera especificado), y luego le transfiere el objeto dado, recibiendo su objeto a cambio.

trans-unit.source: Waits for another thread to arrive at this exchange point (unless the current thread is interrupted), and then transfers the given object to it, receiving its object in return.

trans-unit.source: Waits for card insertion or removal in any of the terminals of this object or until the timeout expires.

Waits for this thread to die.
trans-unit.target: Espera a que este hilo muera.

trans-unit.source: Waits forever for the next available event.
Waits if necessary for at most the given time for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result, if available.
trans-unit.target: Espera,si es necesario,como mucho el tiempo dado para que el cálculo se complete,y luego recupera su resultado,si está disponible.

trans-unit.source: Waits if necessary for at most the given time for this future to complete, and then returns its result, if available.
trans-unit.target: Espera,si es necesario,como mucho el tiempo dado para que este futuro se complete,y luego devuelve su resultado,si está disponible.

trans-unit.source: Waits if necessary for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result.
trans-unit.target: Espera,si es necesario,a que el cómputo se complete,y luego recupera su resultado.

trans-unit.source: Waits if necessary for this future to complete, and then returns its result.
trans-unit.target: Espera,si es necesario,a que este futuro se complete,y luego devuelve su resultado.

trans-unit.source: Waits until a card is absent in this terminal or the timeout expires.
Waits until a card is absent in this terminal or the timeout expires. If the method returns due to an expired timeout, it returns false. Otherwise it return true.
Waits until a card is present in this terminal or the timeout expires.
Waits until a card is present in this terminal or the timeout expires. If the method returns due to an expired timeout, it returns false. Otherwise it return true.
Waits until all parties have invoked await on this barrier, or the specified waiting time elapses.
Waits until all parties have invoked await on this barrier.
Waits until all parties have invoked await on this barrier, or the specified waiting time elapses.
trans-unit.target: Espera hasta que todas las partes hayan invocado await en esta barrera o hasta que transcurra el tiempo de espera especificado.

trans-unit.source: Waits until all parties have invoked await on this barrier.
trans-unit.target: Espera hasta que todas las partes hayan invocado await en esta barrera.

trans-unit.source: Waits until all events currently on the event queue have been processed.
Wakes up a single thread that is waiting on this object's monitor.

Wakes up a single thread that is waiting on this object's monitor. If any threads are waiting on this object, one of them is chosen to be awakened. The choice is arbitrary and occurs at the discretion of the implementation. A thread waits on an object's monitor by calling one of the wait methods.
trans-unit.target: Despierta un único subproceso que está esperando en el monitor de este objeto. Si algún hilo está esperando en este objeto, se elige uno de ellos para ser despertado. La elección es arbitraria y se produce a discreción de la implementación. Un hilo espera en el monitor de un objeto llamando a uno de los métodos de wait .

trans-unit.source: Wakes up all threads that are waiting on this object's monitor.
Wakes up all threads that are waiting on this object's monitor. A thread waits on an object's monitor by calling one of the wait methods.
trans-unit.target: Despierta todos los subprocesos que están esperando en el monitor de este objeto. Un hilo espera en el monitor de un objeto llamando a uno de los métodos de wait .

trans-unit.source: Wakes up all waiting threads.
trans-unit.target: Despierta todos los hilos de la espera.

trans-unit.source: Wakes up one waiting thread.
trans-unit.target: Despierta un hilo de espera.

trans-unit.source: Warning: To avoid deadlock, do not declare this method synchronized in a subclass.

Warning: additional attribute type keywords may not be recognized by other implementations; therefore do not use this method if you are unsure if these keywords will be recognized by other implementations.
trans-unit.target: Advertencia:es posible que las palabras clave de tipo de atributo adicional no sean reconocidas por otras implementaciones;por lo tanto,no utilice este método si no está seguro de que estas palabras clave serán reconocidas por otras implementaciones.

trans-unit.source: Warnings may be retrieved from Connection, Statement, and ResultSet objects. Trying to retrieve a warning on a connection after it has been closed will cause an exception to be thrown. Similarly, trying to retrieve a warning on a statement after it has been closed or on a result set after it has been closed will cause an exception to be thrown. Note that closing a statement also closes a result set that it might have produced.
Watch events are immutable and safe for use by multiple concurrent threads.
trans-unit.target: Los eventos de vigilancia son inmutables y seguros para ser usados por múltiples hilos concurrentes.

trans-unit.source: Watch keys are safe for use by multiple concurrent threads. Where there are several threads retrieving signalled keys from a watch service then care should be taken to ensure that the reset method is only invoked after the events for the object have been processed. This ensures that one thread is processing the events for an object at any time.
trans-unit.target: Las claves de vigilancia son seguras para su uso por varios subprocesos simultáneos. Cuando hay varios subprocesos que recuperan claves señalizadas de un servicio de vigilancia, se debe tener cuidado para garantizar que el método de reset solo se invoque después de que se hayan procesado los eventos para el objeto. Esto garantiza que un subproceso procese los eventos de un objeto en cualquier momento.

trans-unit.source: We can assume in the above scenario that CV.computeValue uses locks to properly observe the time-dependent states as it computes V1, etc. This does not remove the threat of a stale value, since there is a window of time between the return of computeValue in T and the installation of the new value. No user synchronization is possible during this time.

We can assume in the above scenario that CV.computeValue uses locks to properly observe the time-dependent states as it computes V1, etc. This does not remove the threat of a stale value, since there is a window of time between the return of computeValue in T and the installation of the the new value. No user synchronization is possible during this time.
trans-unit.target: Podemos suponer en el escenario anterior que CV.computeValue usa bloqueos para observar correctamente los estados dependientes del tiempo mientras calcula V1 , etc. Esto no elimina la amenaza de un valor obsoleto, ya que hay una ventana de tiempo entre el retorno de computeValue en T y la instalación del nuevo valor. No es posible la sincronización de usuarios durante este tiempo.

trans-unit.source: We draw the background in paintMenuItem() so override update (which fills the background of opaque components by default) to just call paint().
We pass ModelChanged events along to the listeners with the tabbedpane (instead of the model itself) as the event source.

We would get the desired result, and it would even work in parallel. However, we might not be happy about the performance! Such an implementation would do a great deal of string copying, and the run time would be O(n^2) in the number of characters. A more performant approach would be to accumulate the results into a StringBuilder, which is a mutable container for accumulating strings. We can use the same technique to parallelize mutable reduction as we do with ordinary reduction.
trans-unit.target: Obtendríamos el resultado deseado e incluso funcionaría en paralelo. Sin embargo, ¡puede que no estemos contentos con la actuación! Tal implementación haría una gran cantidad de copias de cadenas, y el tiempo de ejecución sería O (n ^ 2) en el número de caracteres. Un enfoque más eficaz sería acumular los resultados en un StringBuilder , que es un contenedor mutable para acumular cadenas. Podemos usar la misma técnica para paralelizar la reducción mutable como lo hacemos con la reducción ordinaria.

trans-unit.source: WebSocket has an input and an output side. These sides are independent from each other. A side can either be open or closed. Once closed, the side remains closed. WebSocket messages are sent through a WebSocket and received through a WebSocket.Listener associated with it. Messages can be sent until the WebSocket's output is closed, and received until the WebSocket's input is closed.

trans-unit.source: Week one (1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the month. Thus, week one may start up to minDays days before the start of the month. If the first week starts after the start of the month then the period before is week zero (0).

Week one (1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the month. Thus, week one may start up to minDays days before the start of the month. If the first week starts after the start of the month then the period before is week zero (0).
trans-unit.target: La semana uno (1) es la semana que comienza en getFirstDayOfWeek() donde hay al menos días getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() en el mes. Por lo tanto, la semana uno puede comenzar hasta minDays días antes del comienzo del mes. Si la primera semana comienza después del comienzo del mes, el período anterior es la semana cero (0).

trans-unit.source: Week one(1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the year. If the first week starts after the start of the year then the period before is in the last week of the previous year.

Week one(1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the year. Thus, week one may start before the start of the year. If the first week starts after the start of the year then the period before is in the last week of the previous year.

Week one(1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the year. Thus, week one may start up to minDays days before the start of the year. If the first week starts after the start of the year then the period before is week zero (0).

Week one(1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the year. If the first week starts after the start of the year then the period before is in the last week of the previous year.
trans-unit.target: La semana uno (1) es la semana que comienza en getFirstDayOfWeek() donde hay al menos días getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() en el año. Si la primera semana comienza después del comienzo del año, el período anterior corresponde a la última semana del año anterior.

trans-unit.source: Week one(1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the year. Thus, week one may start before the start of the year. If the first week starts after the start of the year then the period before is in the last week of the previous year.
trans-unit.target: La semana uno (1) es la semana que comienza en getFirstDayOfWeek() donde hay al menos días getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() en el año. Por lo tanto, la semana uno puede comenzar antes del comienzo del año. Si la primera semana comienza después del comienzo del año, el período anterior corresponde a la última semana del año anterior.

trans-unit.source: Week one(1) is the week starting on the getFirstDayOfWeek() where there are at least getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() days in the year. Thus, week one may start up to minDays days before the start of the year. If the first week starts after the start of the year then the period before is week zero (0).
trans-unit.target: La semana uno (1) es la semana que comienza en getFirstDayOfWeek() donde hay al menos días getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek() en el año. Por lo tanto, la semana uno puede comenzar hasta minDays días antes del comienzo del año. Si la primera semana comienza después del comienzo del año, el período anterior es la semana cero (0).

trans-unit.source: Weight is the overall 'weight' of the glyph in the line. Generally it is proportional to the size of the font. Glyphs with larger weight are allocated a correspondingly larger amount of the change in space.

Well-formed country/region values have the form [a-zA-Z]{2} | [0-9]{3}
trans-unit.target: Los valores de país / región bien formados tienen la forma [a-zA-Z]{2} | [0-9]{3}

trans-unit.source: Well-formed keys are single characters from the set [0-9a-zA-Z]. Well-formed values have the form SUBTAG ('-' SUBTAG)* where for the key 'x' SUBTAG = [0-9a-zA-Z]{1,8} and for other keys SUBTAG = [0-9a-zA-Z]{2,8} (that is, 'x' allows single-character subtags).
trans-unit.target: Las claves bien formadas son caracteres individuales del conjunto [0-9a-zA-Z] . Los valores bien formados tienen la forma SUBTAG ('-' SUBTAG)* donde para la clave 'x' SUBTAG = [0-9a-zA-Z]{1,8} y para otras claves SUBTAG = [0-9a-zA-Z]{2,8} (es decir, 'x' permite subetiquetas de un solo carácter).

trans-unit.source: Well-formed language values have the form [a-zA-Z]{2,8}. Note that this is not the full BCP47 language production, since it excludes extlang. They are not needed since modern three-letter language codes replace them.

Well-formed language values have the form [a-zA-Z]{2,8}. Note that this is not the the full BCP47 language production, since it excludes extlang. They are not needed since modern three-letter language codes replace them.
trans-unit.target: Los valores de lenguaje bien formados tienen la forma [a-zA-Z]{2,8} . Tenga en cuenta que esta no es la producción completa del lenguaje BCP47, ya que excluye extlang. No son necesarios ya que los códigos de idioma modernos de tres letras los reemplazan.

trans-unit.source: Well-formed script values have the form [a-zA-Z]{4}
trans-unit.target: Los valores de secuencia de comandos bien formados tienen la forma [a-zA-Z]{4}

trans-unit.source: Well-formed variant values have the form SUBTAG (('_'|'-') SUBTAG)* where SUBTAG = [0-9][0-9a-zA-Z]{3} | [0-9a-zA-Z]{5,8}. (Note: BCP 47 only uses hyphen ('-') as a delimiter, this is more lenient).
trans-unit.target: Los valores variantes bien formados tienen la forma SUBTAG (('_'|'-') SUBTAG)* donde SUBTAG = [0-9][0-9a-zA-Z]{3} | [0-9a-zA-Z]{5,8} . (Nota: BCP 47 solo usa guión ('-') como delimitador, esto es más indulgente).

trans-unit.source: When sendNotification is called, a listener is selected if it was added with a null NotificationFilter, or if isNotificationEnabled returns true for the notification being sent. The call to NotificationFilter.isNotificationEnabled takes place in the thread that called sendNotification. Then, for each selected listener, executor.execute is called with a command that calls the handleNotification method.

trans-unit.source: When waitFor() returns successfully the CompletableFuture is completed regardless of the exit status of the process. This implementation may consume a lot of memory for thread stacks if a large number of processes are waited for concurrently.

When ContentHandler.startElement(String, String, String, Attributes), ContentHandler.endElement(String, String, String), ContentHandler.startDocument(), or ContentHandler.endDocument() are invoked on a ValidatorHandler, the same method on the user-specified ContentHandler must be invoked for the same event before the callback returns.

When sendNotification is called, a listener is selected if it was added with a null NotificationFilter, or if isNotificationEnabled returns true for the notification being sent. The call to NotificationFilter.isNotificationEnabled takes place in the thread that called sendNotification. Then, for each selected listener, executor.execute is called with a command that calls the handleNotification method.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se llama a sendNotification , se selecciona un oyente si se agregó con un NotificationFilter nulo , o si isNotificationEnabled devuelve verdadero para la notificación que se envía. La llamada a NotificationFilter.isNotificationEnabled tiene lugar en el hilo que llamó a sendNotification . Luego, para cada oyente seleccionado, executor.execute se llama con un comando que llama a la handleNotification método.

trans-unit.source: When FRACTIONALMETRICS are enabled, the true font design metrics are scaled by the point size and used for layout with sub-pixel accuracy. The average density of glyphs and total length of a long string of characters will therefore more closely match the theoretical design of the font, but readability may be affected since individual pairs of characters may not always appear to be consistent distances apart depending on how the sub-pixel accumulation of the glyph origins meshes with the device pixel grid. Enabling this hint may be desirable when text layout is being performed that must be consistent across a wide variety of output resolutions. Specifically, this hint may be desirable in situations where the layout of text is being previewed on a low resolution device like a screen for output that will eventually be rendered on a high resolution printer or typesetting device.

When SSLSockets are first created, no handshaking is done so that applications may first set their communication preferences: what cipher suites to use, whether the socket should be in client or server mode, etc. However, security is always provided by the time that application data is sent over the connection.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se SSLSocket s por primera vez, no se realiza ningún protocolo de enlace para que las aplicaciones puedan establecer primero sus preferencias de comunicación: qué conjuntos de cifrado usar, si el socket debe estar en modo cliente o servidor, etc. Sin embargo, la seguridad siempre se proporciona en el momento en que los datos de la aplicación se envían a través de la conexión.

trans-unit.source: When SecurityManager is installed, the invoking thread must be granted this permission in order to replace the current KeyboardFocusManager. If permission is not granted, a SecurityException will be thrown.
When T attempts to install the newly computed value, if the state is still at 2N, the class value will be initialized with the computed value, advancing it to state 2N+1.
trans-unit.target: Cuando T intenta instalar el valor recién calculado, si el estado todavía está en 2N , el valor de la clase se inicializará con el valor calculado, avanzando al estado 2N+1 .

trans-unit.source: When jdk.io.permissionsUseCanonicalPath is false, an invalid FilePermission does not equal to any object except for itself, even if they are created using the same invalid path.

When setAutoCreateRowSorter(true) is invoked, a TableRowSorter is immediately created and installed on the table. While the autoCreateRowSorter property remains true, every time the model is changed, a new TableRowSorter is created and set as the table's row sorter. The default value for the autoCreateRowSorter property is false.

When setMaximum is called, the maximum value is changed, and other values (including the minimum, the visible amount, and the current scroll bar value) are changed to be consistent with the new maximum.

When setMinimum is called, the minimum value is changed, and other values (including the maximum, the visible amount, and the current scroll bar value) are changed to be consistent with the new minimum.

When setValue is called on the sum spring, s3, the strain in s3 is calculated using one of the formulas above. Once the strain of the sum is known, the values of s1 and s2 are then set so that they are have a strain equal to that of the sum. The formulas are evaluated so as to take rounding errors into account and ensure that the sum of the values of s1 and s2 is exactly equal to the value of s3.
When targetSize is outside the [MIN, MAX] range, the algorithm sets all sizes to their appropriate limiting value (maximum or minimum).

When this instance has an undefined field, this conversion relies on the java.util.GregorianCalendar default for its corresponding field. A notable difference between XML Schema 1.0 date/time datatypes and java.util.GregorianCalendar is that Timezone value is optional for date/time datatypes and it is a required field for java.util.GregorianCalendar. See javadoc for java.util.TimeZone.getDefault() on how the default is determined. To explicitly specify the TimeZone instance, see toGregorianCalendar(TimeZone, Locale, XMLGregorianCalendar).
When type has the value "Radio" or "Checkbox", this represents the HTML checked attribute of the element.

When type has the value "Radio" or "Checkbox", this represents the HTML checked attribute of the element. The value of this attribute does not change if the state of the corresponding form control, in an interactive user agent, changes. Changes to this attribute, however, resets the state of the form control. See the checked attribute definition in HTML 4.0.

When FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING is enabled, it is recommended that implementations restrict external connections by default, though this may cause problems for applications that process XML/XSD/XSL with external references.

When FLAG_SERIALIZABLE is set in flags, the function objects will implement Serializable, and will have a writeReplace method that returns an appropriate SerializedLambda. The caller class must have an appropriate $deserializeLambda$ method, as described in SerializedLambda.
trans-unit.target: Cuando FLAG_SERIALIZABLE se establece en flags , los objetos de función implementarán Serializable y tendrán un método writeReplace que devuelve un SerializedLambda apropiado . La clase de caller debe tener un método $deserializeLambda$ apropiado , como se describe en SerializedLambda .

trans-unit.source: When JNDI constructs an initial context, the context's environment is initialized with properties defined in the environment parameter passed to the constructor, the system properties, and the application resource files. See InitialContext for details. This initial environment is then inherited by other context instances.

When JNDI constructs an initial context, the context's environment is initialized with properties defined in the environment parameter passed to the constructor, the system properties, the applet parameters, and the application resource files. See InitialContext for details. This initial environment is then inherited by other context instances.
trans-unit.target: Cuando JNDI construye un contexto inicial, el entorno del contexto se inicializa con las propiedades definidas en el parámetro de entorno que se pasa al constructor, las propiedades del sistema, los parámetros del subprograma y los archivos de recursos de la aplicación. Consulte InitialContext para obtener más detalles. Este entorno inicial luego es heredado por otras instancias de contexto.

trans-unit.source: When Java Sound is used to handle system exclusive data that is being received using MIDI wire protocol, it should place the data in one or more SysexMessages. In this case, the length of the system exclusive data is not known in advance; the end of the system exclusive data is marked by an end-of-exclusive flag (0xF7) in the MIDI wire byte stream.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se usa Java Sound para manejar datos exclusivos del sistema que se reciben mediante el protocolo de cable MIDI, debe colocar los datos en uno o más SysexMessages . En este caso, la longitud de los datos exclusivos del sistema no se conoce de antemano; el final de los datos exclusivos del sistema se marca con un indicador de fin de exclusividad (0xF7) en el flujo de bytes del cable MIDI.

trans-unit.source: When LoginContext uses a caller-specified Configuration, the caller does not require any createLoginContext AuthPermission. The LoginContext saves the AccessControlContext for the caller, and invokes the configured modules from within an AccessController.doPrivileged call constrained by that context. This means the caller context (stored when the LoginContext was created) must have sufficient permissions to perform any security-sensitive tasks that the modules may perform.
trans-unit.target: Cuando LoginContext usa una configuración especificada por la persona que llama, la persona que llama no requiere ningún permiso de autenticación createLoginContext. El LoginContext guarda el AccessControlContext para la persona que llama e invoca los módulos configurados desde dentro de una llamada AccessController.doPrivileged restringida por ese contexto. Esto significa que el contexto de la persona que llama (almacenado cuando se creó el LoginContext) debe tener permisos suficientes para realizar cualquier tarea sensible a la seguridad que puedan realizar los módulos.

trans-unit.source: When LoginContext uses the installed Configuration, the caller requires the createLoginContext.name and possibly createLoginContext.other AuthPermissions. Furthermore, the LoginContext will invoke configured modules from within an AccessController.doPrivileged call so that modules that perform security-sensitive tasks (such as connecting to remote hosts, and updating the Subject) will require the respective permissions, but the callers of the LoginContext will not require those permissions.
trans-unit.target: Cuando LoginContext usa la configuración instalada, la persona que llama requiere el createLoginContext. name y posiblemente createLoginContext.other AuthPermissions. Además, el LoginContext invocará los módulos configurados desde dentro de una llamada AccessController.doPrivileged para que los módulos que realizan tareas sensibles a la seguridad (como conectarse a hosts remotos y actualizar el Asunto) requieran los permisos respectivos, pero las personas que llaman del LoginContext no requieren esos permisos.

trans-unit.source: When W3C XML Schema validation is being performed, in the case where an element has a union type, the TypeInfo returned by a call to getElementTypeInfo() from the startElement event will be the union type. The TypeInfo returned by a call from the endElement event will be the actual member type used to validate the element.
When a SecurityManager is active then an application that creates a LoginContext and uses a LoginModule must be granted certain permissions.
When a SecurityManager set, this is the permission which will be checked when code invokes VirtualMachine.attach to attach to a target virtual machine.

When a SecurityManager set, this is the permission which will be checked when code invokes VirtualMachine.attach to attach to a target virtual machine. This permission is also checked when an AttachProvider is created.
When a ContentHandler is specified, a ValidatorHandler will work as a filter and basically copy the incoming events to the specified ContentHandler.
When a Schema is non-null, a parser will use a validator created from it to validate documents before it passes information down to the application.

When a BeansLinker is configured without a missing member handler factory, or the factory returns null for a particular handler creation invocation, the default behavior is used. The default behavior is to return null from GuardingDynamicLinker.getGuardedInvocation(LinkRequest, LinkerServices) when it can be determined at link time that the linked operation will never address an existing member. This lets the DynamicLinker attempt the next linker if there is one, or ultimately fail the link request with NoSuchDynamicMethodException. For other cases (typically all unnamed member operations as well as most named operations on collection elements) BeansLinker will produce a conditional linkage that will return null when invoked at runtime with a name that does not match any member for getters and silently ignore the passed values for setters.
When a Boolean return type is requested, Boolean.TRUE is returned if one or more nodes were selected; otherwise, Boolean.FALSE is returned.

When a Calendar is in non-lenient mode, it throws an exception if there is any inconsistency in its calendar fields. For example, a GregorianCalendar always produces DAY_OF_MONTH values between 1 and the length of the month. A non-lenient GregorianCalendar throws an exception upon calculating its time or calendar field values if any out-of-range field value has been set.
trans-unit.target: Cuando un Calendar está en modo no indulgente, lanza una excepción si hay alguna inconsistencia en sus campos de calendario. Por ejemplo, un GregorianCalendar siempre produce valores de DAY_OF_MONTH entre 1 y la duración del mes. Un GregorianCalendar no indulgente lanza una excepción al calcular sus valores de campo de tiempo o calendario si se ha establecido algún valor de campo fuera de rango.

trans-unit.source: When a CompletionStage returned from Listener.onClose completes, the WebSocket will send a Close message that has the same code the received message has and an empty reason.
When a DatagramSocket is created the initial setting of SO_REUSEADDR is disabled.
